00040 #endif

00053 static int
00054 kernel_sock_unlocked_ioctl(struct file *filp, int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00055 {
00056         mm_segment_t oldfs = get_fs();
00057         int err;
00058 
00059         set_fs(KERNEL_DS);
00060         err = filp->f_op->unlocked_ioctl(filp, cmd, arg);
00061         set_fs(oldfs);
00062 
00063         return err;
00064 }
00065 
00066 static int
00067 lnet_sock_ioctl(int cmd, unsigned long arg)
00068 {
00069         struct file    *sock_filp;
00070         struct socket  *sock;
00071         int             fd = -1;
00072         int             rc;
00073 
00074         rc = sock_create(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0, &sock);
00075         if (rc != 0) {
00076                 CERROR("Can't create socket: %d\n", rc);
00077                 return rc;
00078         }
00079 
00080 #if !defined(HAVE_SOCK_ALLOC_FILE) && !defined(HAVE_SOCK_ALLOC_FILE_3ARGS)
00081         fd = sock_map_fd(sock, 0);
00082         if (fd < 0) {
00083                 rc = fd;
00084                 sock_release(sock);
00085                 goto out;
00086         }
00087         sock_filp = fget(fd);
00088 #else
00089 # ifdef HAVE_SOCK_ALLOC_FILE_3ARGS
00090         sock_filp = sock_alloc_file(sock, 0, NULL);
00091 # else
00092         sock_filp = sock_alloc_file(sock, 0);
00093 # endif
00094 #endif
00095         if (IS_ERR(sock_filp)) {
00096                 rc = PTR_ERR(sock_filp);
00097                 sock_release(sock);
00098                 goto out;
00099         }
00100 
00101         rc = kernel_sock_unlocked_ioctl(sock_filp, cmd, arg);
00102 
00103         fput(sock_filp);
00104 out:
00105         if (fd >= 0)
00106                 sys_close(fd);
00107         return rc;
00108 }

00110 int
00111 lnet_ipif_query(char *name, int *up, __u32 *ip, __u32 *mask)
00112 {
00113         struct ifreq    ifr;
00114         int             nob;
00115         int             rc;
00116         __u32           val;
00117 
00118         nob = strnlen(name, IFNAMSIZ);
00119         if (nob == IFNAMSIZ) {
00120                 CERROR("Interface name %s too long\n", name);
00121                 return -EINVAL;
00122         }
00123 
00124         CLASSERT(sizeof(ifr.ifr_name) >= IFNAMSIZ);
00125 
00126         if (strlen(name) > sizeof(ifr.ifr_name)-1)
00127                 return -E2BIG;
00128         strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, name, sizeof(ifr.ifr_name));
00129 
00130         rc = lnet_sock_ioctl(SIOCGIFFLAGS, (unsigned long)&ifr);
00131         if (rc != 0) {
00132                 CERROR("Can't get flags for interface %s\n", name);
00133                 return rc;
00134         }
00135 
00136         if ((ifr.ifr_flags & IFF_UP) == 0) {
00137                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "Interface %s down\n", name);
00138                 *up = 0;
00139                 *ip = *mask = 0;
00140                 return 0;
00141         }
00142         *up = 1;
00143 
00144         if (strlen(name) > sizeof(ifr.ifr_name)-1)
00145                 return -E2BIG;
00146         strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, name, sizeof(ifr.ifr_name));
00147 
00148         ifr.ifr_addr.sa_family = AF_INET;
00149         rc = lnet_sock_ioctl(SIOCGIFADDR, (unsigned long)&ifr);
00150 
00151         if (rc != 0) {
00152                 CERROR("Can't get IP address for interface %s\n", name);
00153                 return rc;
00154         }
00155 
00156         val = ((struct sockaddr_in *)&ifr.ifr_addr)->sin_addr.s_addr;
00157         *ip = ntohl(val);
00158 
00159         if (strlen(name) > sizeof(ifr.ifr_name)-1)
00160                 return -E2BIG;
00161         strncpy(ifr.ifr_name, name, sizeof(ifr.ifr_name));
00162 
00163         ifr.ifr_addr.sa_family = AF_INET;
00164         rc = lnet_sock_ioctl(SIOCGIFNETMASK, (unsigned long)&ifr);
00165         if (rc != 0) {
00166                 CERROR("Can't get netmask for interface %s\n", name);
00167                 return rc;
00168         }
00169 
00170         val = ((struct sockaddr_in *)&ifr.ifr_netmask)->sin_addr.s_addr;
00171         *mask = ntohl(val);
00172 
00173         return 0;
00174 }
00175 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_ipif_query);
00176 
00177 void
00178 lnet_ipif_free_enumeration(char **names, int n)
00179 {
00180         int     i;
00181 
00182         LASSERT(n > 0);
00183 
00184         for (i = 0; i < n && names[i] != NULL; i++)
00185                 LIBCFS_FREE(names[i], IFNAMSIZ);
00186 
00187         LIBCFS_FREE(names, n * sizeof(*names));
00188 }
00189 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_ipif_free_enumeration);
00190 
00191 int
00192 lnet_ipif_enumerate(char ***namesp)
00193 {
00194         /* Allocate and fill in 'names', returning # interfaces/error */
00195         char          **names;
00196         int             toobig;
00197         int             nalloc;
00198         int             nfound;
00199         struct ifreq   *ifr;
00200         struct ifconf   ifc;
00201         int             rc;
00202         int             nob;
00203         int             i;
00204 
00205         nalloc = 16;    /* first guess at max interfaces */
00206         toobig = 0;
00207         for (;;) {
00208                 if (nalloc * sizeof(*ifr) > PAGE_CACHE_SIZE) {
00209                         toobig = 1;
00210                         nalloc = PAGE_CACHE_SIZE/sizeof(*ifr);
00211                         CWARN("Too many interfaces: only enumerating "
00212                               "first %d\n", nalloc);
00213                 }
00214 
00215                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(ifr, nalloc * sizeof(*ifr));
00216                 if (ifr == NULL) {
00217                         CERROR("ENOMEM enumerating up to %d interfaces\n",
00218                                nalloc);
00219                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00220                         goto out0;
00221                 }
00222 
00223                 ifc.ifc_buf = (char *)ifr;
00224                 ifc.ifc_len = nalloc * sizeof(*ifr);
00225 
00226                 rc = lnet_sock_ioctl(SIOCGIFCONF, (unsigned long)&ifc);
00227                 if (rc < 0) {
00228                         CERROR("Error %d enumerating interfaces\n", rc);
00229                         goto out1;
00230                 }
00231 
00232                 LASSERT(rc == 0);
00233 
00234                 nfound = ifc.ifc_len/sizeof(*ifr);
00235                 LASSERT(nfound <= nalloc);
00236 
00237                 if (nfound < nalloc || toobig)
00238                         break;
00239 
00240                 LIBCFS_FREE(ifr, nalloc * sizeof(*ifr));
00241                 nalloc *= 2;
00242         }
00243 
00244         if (nfound == 0)
00245                 goto out1;
00246 
00247         LIBCFS_ALLOC(names, nfound * sizeof(*names));
00248         if (names == NULL) {
00249                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00250                 goto out1;
00251         }
00252 
00253         for (i = 0; i < nfound; i++) {
00254                 nob = strnlen(ifr[i].ifr_name, IFNAMSIZ);
00255                 if (nob == IFNAMSIZ) {
00256                         /* no space for terminating NULL */
00257                         CERROR("interface name %.*s too long (%d max)\n",
00258                                nob, ifr[i].ifr_name, IFNAMSIZ);
00259                         rc = -ENAMETOOLONG;
00260                         goto out2;
00261                 }
00262 
00263                 LIBCFS_ALLOC(names[i], IFNAMSIZ);
00264                 if (names[i] == NULL) {
00265                         rc = -ENOMEM;
00266                         goto out2;
00267                 }
00268 
00269                 memcpy(names[i], ifr[i].ifr_name, nob);
00270                 names[i][nob] = 0;
00271         }
00272 
00273         *namesp = names;
00274         rc = nfound;
00275 
00276  out2:
00277         if (rc < 0)
00278                 lnet_ipif_free_enumeration(names, nfound);
00279  out1:
00280         LIBCFS_FREE(ifr, nalloc * sizeof(*ifr));
00281  out0:
00282         return rc;
00283 }
00284 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_ipif_enumerate);
00285 
00286 int
00287 lnet_sock_write(struct socket *sock, void *buffer, int nob, int timeout)
00288 {
00289         int             rc;
00290         long            jiffies_left = timeout * msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00291         unsigned long   then;
00292         struct timeval  tv;
00293 
00294         LASSERT(nob > 0);
00295         /* Caller may pass a zero timeout if she thinks the socket buffer is
00296          * empty enough to take the whole message immediately */
00297 
00298         for (;;) {
00299                 struct kvec  iov = {
00300                         .iov_base = buffer,
00301                         .iov_len  = nob
00302                 };
00303                 struct msghdr msg = {
00304                         .msg_flags      = (timeout == 0) ? MSG_DONTWAIT : 0
00305                 };
00306 
00307                 if (timeout != 0) {
00308                         /* Set send timeout to remaining time */
00309                         tv = (struct timeval) {
00310                                 .tv_sec = jiffies_left /
00311                                           msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC),
00312                                 .tv_usec = ((jiffies_left %
00313                                              msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) *
00314                                              USEC_PER_SEC) /
00315                                              msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)
00316                         };
00317 
00318                         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDTIMEO,
00319                                                (char *)&tv, sizeof(tv));
00320                         if (rc != 0) {
00321                                 CERROR("Can't set socket send timeout "
00322                                        "%ld.%06d: %d\n",
00323                                        (long)tv.tv_sec, (int)tv.tv_usec, rc);
00324                                 return rc;
00325                         }
00326                 }
00327 
00328                 then = jiffies;
00329                 rc = kernel_sendmsg(sock, &msg, &iov, 1, nob);
00330                 jiffies_left -= jiffies - then;
00331 
00332                 if (rc == nob)
00333                         return 0;
00334 
00335                 if (rc < 0)
00336                         return rc;
00337 
00338                 if (rc == 0) {
00339                         CERROR("Unexpected zero rc\n");
00340                         return -ECONNABORTED;
00341                 }
00342 
00343                 if (jiffies_left <= 0)
00344                         return -EAGAIN;
00345 
00346                 buffer = ((char *)buffer) + rc;
00347                 nob -= rc;
00348         }
00349         return 0;
00350 }
00351 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_sock_write);
00352 
00353 int
00354 lnet_sock_read(struct socket *sock, void *buffer, int nob, int timeout)
00355 {
00356         int             rc;
00357         long            jiffies_left = timeout * msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC);
00358         unsigned long   then;
00359         struct timeval  tv;
00360 
00361         LASSERT(nob > 0);
00362         LASSERT(jiffies_left > 0);
00363 
00364         for (;;) {
00365                 struct kvec  iov = {
00366                         .iov_base = buffer,
00367                         .iov_len  = nob
00368                 };
00369                 struct msghdr msg = {
00370                         .msg_flags      = 0
00371                 };
00372 
00373                 /* Set receive timeout to remaining time */
00374                 tv = (struct timeval) {
00375                         .tv_sec = jiffies_left / msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC),
00376                         .tv_usec = ((jiffies_left %
00377                                         msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)) *
00378                                         USEC_PER_SEC) /
00379                                         msecs_to_jiffies(MSEC_PER_SEC)
00380                 };
00381                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO,
00382                                        (char *)&tv, sizeof(tv));
00383                 if (rc != 0) {
00384                         CERROR("Can't set socket recv timeout %ld.%06d: %d\n",
00385                                (long)tv.tv_sec, (int)tv.tv_usec, rc);
00386                         return rc;
00387                 }
00388 
00389                 then = jiffies;
00390                 rc = kernel_recvmsg(sock, &msg, &iov, 1, nob, 0);
00391                 jiffies_left -= jiffies - then;
00392 
00393                 if (rc < 0)
00394                         return rc;
00395 
00396                 if (rc == 0)
00397                         return -ECONNRESET;
00398 
00399                 buffer = ((char *)buffer) + rc;
00400                 nob -= rc;
00401 
00402                 if (nob == 0)
00403                         return 0;
00404 
00405                 if (jiffies_left <= 0)
00406                         return -ETIMEDOUT;
00407         }
00408 }
00409 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_sock_read);
00410 
00411 static int
00412 lnet_sock_create(struct socket **sockp, int *fatal,
00413                  __u32 local_ip, int local_port)
00414 {
00415         struct sockaddr_in  locaddr;
00416         struct socket      *sock;
00417         int                 rc;
00418         int                 option;
00419 
00420         /* All errors are fatal except bind failure if the port is in use */
00421         *fatal = 1;
00422 
00423         rc = sock_create(PF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0, &sock);
00424         *sockp = sock;
00425         if (rc != 0) {
00426                 CERROR("Can't create socket: %d\n", rc);
00427                 return rc;
00428         }
00429 
00430         option = 1;
00431         rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR,
00432                                (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00433         if (rc != 0) {
00434                 CERROR("Can't set SO_REUSEADDR for socket: %d\n", rc);
00435                 goto failed;
00436         }
00437 
00438         if (local_ip != 0 || local_port != 0) {
00439                 memset(&locaddr, 0, sizeof(locaddr));
00440                 locaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00441                 locaddr.sin_port = htons(local_port);
00442                 locaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = (local_ip == 0) ?
00443                                           INADDR_ANY : htonl(local_ip);
00444 
00445                 rc = kernel_bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&locaddr,
00446                                  sizeof(locaddr));
00447                 if (rc == -EADDRINUSE) {
00448                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Port %d already in use\n", local_port);
00449                         *fatal = 0;
00450                         goto failed;
00451                 }
00452                 if (rc != 0) {
00453                         CERROR("Error trying to bind to port %d: %d\n",
00454                                local_port, rc);
00455                         goto failed;
00456                 }
00457         }
00458         return 0;
00459 
00460 failed:
00461         sock_release(sock);
00462         return rc;
00463 }
00464 
00465 int
00466 lnet_sock_setbuf(struct socket *sock, int txbufsize, int rxbufsize)
00467 {
00468         int                 option;
00469         int                 rc;
00470 
00471         if (txbufsize != 0) {
00472                 option = txbufsize;
00473                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF,
00474                                        (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00475                 if (rc != 0) {
00476                         CERROR("Can't set send buffer %d: %d\n",
00477                                 option, rc);
00478                         return rc;
00479                 }
00480         }
00481 
00482         if (rxbufsize != 0) {
00483                 option = rxbufsize;
00484                 rc = kernel_setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF,
00485                                        (char *)&option, sizeof(option));
00486                 if (rc != 0) {
00487                         CERROR("Can't set receive buffer %d: %d\n",
00488                                 option, rc);
00489                         return rc;
00490                 }
00491         }
00492         return 0;
00493 }
00494 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_sock_setbuf);
00495 
00496 int
00497 lnet_sock_getaddr(struct socket *sock, bool remote, __u32 *ip, int *port)
00498 {
00499         struct sockaddr_in sin;
00500         int                len = sizeof(sin);
00501         int                rc;
00502 
00503         if (remote)
00504                 rc = kernel_getpeername(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &len);
00505         else
00506                 rc = kernel_getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &len);
00507         if (rc != 0) {
00508                 CERROR("Error %d getting sock %s IP/port\n",
00509                         rc, remote ? "peer" : "local");
00510                 return rc;
00511         }
00512 
00513         if (ip != NULL)
00514                 *ip = ntohl(sin.sin_addr.s_addr);
00515 
00516         if (port != NULL)
00517                 *port = ntohs(sin.sin_port);
00518 
00519         return 0;
00520 }
00521 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_sock_getaddr);
00522 
00523 int
00524 lnet_sock_getbuf(struct socket *sock, int *txbufsize, int *rxbufsize)
00525 {
00526         if (txbufsize != NULL)
00527                 *txbufsize = sock->sk->sk_sndbuf;
00528 
00529         if (rxbufsize != NULL)
00530                 *rxbufsize = sock->sk->sk_rcvbuf;
00531 
00532         return 0;
00533 }
00534 EXPORT_SYMBOL(lnet_sock_getbuf);
00535 
00536 int
00537 lnet_sock_listen(struct socket **sockp,
00538                    __u32 local_ip, int local_port, int backlog)
00539 {
00540         int      fatal;
00541         int      rc;
00542 
00543         rc = lnet_sock_create(sockp, &fatal, local_ip, local_port);
00544         if (rc != 0) {
00545                 if (!fatal)
00546                         CERROR("Can't create socket: port %d already in use\n",
00547                                local_port);
00548                 return rc;
00549         }
00550 
00551         rc = kernel_listen(*sockp, backlog);
00552         if (rc == 0)
00553                 return 0;
00554 
00555         CERROR("Can't set listen backlog %d: %d\n", backlog, rc);
00556         sock_release(*sockp);
00557         return rc;
00558 }
00559 
00560 #ifndef HAVE_SK_SLEEP
00561 static inline wait_queue_head_t *sk_sleep(struct sock *sk)
00562 {
00563         return sk->sk_sleep;
00564 }
00565 #endif
00566 
00567 int
00568 lnet_sock_accept(struct socket **newsockp, struct socket *sock)
00569 {
00570         wait_queue_t   wait;
00571         struct socket *newsock;
00572         int            rc;
00573 
00574         /* XXX this should add a ref to sock->ops->owner, if
00575          * TCP could be a module */
00576         rc = sock_create_lite(PF_PACKET, sock->type, IPPROTO_TCP, &newsock);
00577         if (rc) {
00578                 CERROR("Can't allocate socket\n");
00579                 return rc;
00580         }
00581 
00582         newsock->ops = sock->ops;
00583 
00584         rc = sock->ops->accept(sock, newsock, O_NONBLOCK);
00585         if (rc == -EAGAIN) {
00586                 /* Nothing ready, so wait for activity */
00587                 init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
00588                 add_wait_queue(sk_sleep(sock->sk), &wait);
00589                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00590                 schedule();
00591                 remove_wait_queue(sk_sleep(sock->sk), &wait);
00592                 rc = sock->ops->accept(sock, newsock, O_NONBLOCK);
00593         }
00594 
00595         if (rc != 0)
00596                 goto failed;
00597 
00598         *newsockp = newsock;
00599         return 0;
00600 
00601 failed:
00602         sock_release(newsock);
00603         return rc;
00604 }
00605 
00606 int
00607 lnet_sock_connect(struct socket **sockp, int *fatal,
00608                   __u32 local_ip, int local_port,
00609                   __u32 peer_ip, int peer_port)
00610 {
00611         struct sockaddr_in  srvaddr;
00612         int                 rc;
00613 
00614         rc = lnet_sock_create(sockp, fatal, local_ip, local_port);
00615         if (rc != 0)
00616                 return rc;
00617 
00618         memset(&srvaddr, 0, sizeof(srvaddr));
00619         srvaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
00620         srvaddr.sin_port = htons(peer_port);
00621         srvaddr.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(peer_ip);
00622 
00623         rc = kernel_connect(*sockp, (struct sockaddr *)&srvaddr,
00624                             sizeof(srvaddr), 0);
00625         if (rc == 0)
00626                 return 0;
00627 
00628         /* EADDRNOTAVAIL probably means we're already connected to the same
00629          * peer/port on the same local port on a differently typed
00630          * connection.  Let our caller retry with a different local
00631          * port... */
00632         *fatal = !(rc == -EADDRNOTAVAIL);
00633 
00634         CDEBUG_LIMIT(*fatal ? D_NETERROR : D_NET,
00635                "Error %d connecting %pI4h/%d -> %pI4h/%d\n", rc,
00636                &local_ip, local_port, &peer_ip, peer_port);
00637 
00638         sock_release(*sockp);
00639         return rc;
00640 }
